title: How long did it take medieval armies to prepare for large battles? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on the goverment discipline, Ottomans were able to gather large forces in short time.  For Ottomans, first Emperor would send letters to governors and judges near war region. Repair Castles and BridgesExpand and clean the roadsFill food and water capacityWhile this happening in few days Emperor would start travelling from the capital with a ceremony.  Every soldier would take : (Ottomans gave two hot meal per day) 320 gr bread160 gr biscuit (if there is no fresh bread)200 gr mutton160 gr rice80 gr fatWe know that Ottomans would gather 100.000 sheep to feed such large army.  Letters would sent to Cannon Foundries and cannons would start travelling, Timariots would get ready in their region, all power would unite under Emperor's banner.  120.000 soldier Ottoman army started their campaign from Constantinople in May 10 and arrived Hungary in August 18. Which means it took roughly 3 month to reach Istanbul to Hungary with 120.000 men army.
